intro: Telipogon javiercastroviejoi, commonly known as the Javier Castroviejo's telipogon, is a rare orchid species native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and intricate floral structures. The plant typically produces small, fragrant flowers with a distinctive coloration pattern, often featuring a combination of white, green, and purple hues. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests or rocky substrates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
